column2: Agreement ID (Dummy Value)
column5: Agreement NO (Dummy)

column2: Frequency of the loan payment, It can be monthly, half yearly etc
column5: This field implies whether Tradeline belong to LTFS or not. In the event of self match value will be "True " else false.

column2: It can be either advance or an arrear while opening the account
column5: Type of match for Primary / Secondary or In other words Account of Applicant or CoApplicant

column2: Active Or closed Account at this point of time
column5: This field implies an account type assigned by the financial institute to the borrower

column2:
Payement Mode at the start of loan. It can be cheque(PDC), ECS etc
  (You may need to club them based on their similarity). Example cheque and PDC are same.
column5:
Whether it’s a government bank, private bank, nbfc etc
  NBF: Its NBFC
  MFI:- MircroFiannce Institution (Check column G)
  This field implies the Type of lender who granted the loan.

column2: This field implies the client's loan disbursing branch
column5: This field implies the date up to which information is reported.

column2: Area at which the branch is present( Superset of Branch)
column5: This field implies the repayment responsibility

column2: Tenure of the loan
column5: This field displays the status of loan account.

column2: Cost of asset involved of the given loan
column5: This field implies the date of credit disbursement .

column2: Most of the time its equivalent to disbursal amount but in some cases it may vary
column5: This field implies the date of account closure.

column2: Loan Amount given for a loan
column5: This field implies the date of last payment of an installment.

column2: EMI for each month
column5: This field implies the amount that is sanctioned by credit institution or credit limit - incase of credit cards

column2: Disbursal date for a loan
column5: This field displays Disbursed amount of loan/credit as at the end of reporting period.

column2: Maturity date at which the given loan will end
column5: This field implies the Installment/EMI to be paid.

column2: Autharization date of loan, it usually is earlier than disbursal date
column5: This field implies the outstanding amount a borrower still owes on a particular credit facilit

column2: AssetID is a key generated for an asset for example an eicher tractor has different id than tractor of other brands
column5: This field implies the Installment frequency for the account

column2: Kind of assets for which the loan is taken Tractor, Harvestor etc
column5: This field implies the amount that has been overdue in the account.

column2: Sonalika, Eicher etc, brands which manufacture these heavy machinaries used in farming.
column5: This field implies the total loan amount written-off by the lender.

column2: Supplier from which the purchase was done
column5:
This field displays classification of the account as either of the following -
  Standard
  SubStandard
  Special Mention Account
  Loss
  Doubtful

column2: Loan to value (borrowed amount against the appraised value of the property )
column5: This field implies the 36 month history of Reported Date History for the particular account.

column2: Gender of the customer
column5:
This field implies the 36 month history of Days Past Due for the particular account.
  000 = 0 payments past due (current account)
  001 to 999 = Number days past due. If an account is above 999 days, mark as 999
  XXX = No payment history available prior to this time. An “X” may not be embedded within other values.
  DDD = No payment history available this month. “D” may be embedded in the payment pattern.

column2: Age of the customer
column5: This field implies the Current balance history for 36 months.

column2: Income of the customer
column5: This field implies the Amount Overdue history for 36 months.

column2: City of the given address
column5: This field implies the Amount Paid history for 36 months.
